page.title: 19Templeton Business Centre
page.content: This is a large complex of workshops and offices housed in seven buildings formerly occupied by Templeton's Carpets Ltd. This includes a building modelled on the Doge's Palace in Venice which was designed by William Leiper and constructed in 1888. A symbol of Glasgow at the height of it's 19th century development it is now the centrepiece of the Templeton Business Centre and the base for the advancing technologies of electronics, telecommunications, biotechnology and optoelectronics. The other buildings house the offices of architects, an accountant, an advertising agency and a video film company and workshops for joiners, engineers, a saddlemaker, a textile company and an Information Technology Centre. This project is a product of the S.D.A and aims to promote employment.
